javanews.events.gui
Class CloseLinkChart

java.lang.Object
  javanews.events.gui.CloseLinkChart
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.InternalFrameListener
public class CloseLinkChart
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.event.InternalFrameListener

This class is responsible for handling events generated and related to the closure of an instance of LinkChart which displays a set of dynamically updated charts for links used within the application.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)

Constructor Detail

CloseLinkChart

public CloseLinkChart(LinkChart lcParent)
Initialises the class and internal logger. It requires the instance of LinkChart that this class instance is responsible for to be passed as an argument.

Parameters:
lcParent - The instance of LinkChart that the instance will close

closeWindow

private void closeWindow()
This method is called by both the actionPerformed() and windowClosing() methods. The actual functions are stored in this method to further centralise the code being executed. Any changes to the execution of the program during shutdown should be made here.

The method closes the open instance of LinkChart and performs garbage collection.
